newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Nov 7.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Nov 7.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Time Warner Inc won a major court battle Wednesday when a federal judge issued a preliminary injunction that stops New York City from airing Rupert Murdoch's Fox News on a city-run cable television channel. Also Moody's Investors Service assigned a "Ba2" rating to News Corporation Exchange Trust's exchangeable trust originated preferred securities (TOPrs). News was also given an initial neutral rating by Lehman brothers.

Aber Resources Ltd said in Vancouver overnight diamonds from the A-154 South Pipe at the Diavik property in Canada's Northwest Territories were valued at an average US$56.10 a carat based on a sample of about 7,210 carats. The valuation was done by CRA Diamonds, a unit of RTZ Corp Plc-CRA Ltd which holds a 60 percent stake in the property through RTZ's Kennecott unit.
* Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd A$16.71 (-0.13)
Allegheny Teledyne Inc said in a letter to customers it will increase prices on stainless steel sheet, strip and plate products, reducing discounts by three percentage points from March 3.
* National Australia Bank Ltd A$13.85 (-0.04) Thailand has granted an offshore banking licence to National Australia Bank Ltd, The Australian newspaper reported on Thursday.

Progressive Enterprises Ltd said on Thursday total group sales for the 13 weeks ended October 27 were NZ$517.98 million. This was 0.5 percent below the first quarter of the previous year. Foodland owns 58 percent of progressive.

Freedom Furniture Ltd said on Thursday it had made earnings before interest, tax and abnormals (EBIT) of A$10.2 million for the 12 months to September 30, 1996 and would post a final dividend of 1.5 cents per share.

Devex Ltd said on Thursday its previously announced share buyback would proceed on a 1-for-11 basis, with each share to be priced at 55 cents. It said this payment represented a 28 percent premium over the average share market price over the last 30 days.
